text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Diligence is the mother of good luck.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: A penny saved is two pence clear.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Hitch your wagon to a star.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Our life is frittered away by detail; simplify, simplify.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Courage is reckoned the greatest of all virtues; because, unless a man has that virtue, he has no security for preserving any other.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

text: What we obtain too cheap, we esteem too lightly.
author: Thomas Paine

text: To err is human; to forgive, divine.
author: Alexander Pope

text: A little learning is a dangerous thing.
author: Alexander Pope

text: Acta non verba.
author: Latin Proverb

text: Knowledge itself is power.
author: Francis Bacon

text: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Reading maketh a full man; conference a ready man; and writing an exact man.
author: Francis Bacon

text: There is a tide in the affairs of men, which taken at the flood, leads on to fortune.
author: William Shakespeare

text: The better part of Valour, is Discretion.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Strong reasons make strong actions.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Action is eloquence.
author: William Shakespeare

text: This above all: to thine own self be true.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Sweet are the uses of adversity.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Wisely and slow; they stumble that run fast.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Suit the action to the word, the word to the action.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Things won are done; joy’s soul lies in the doing.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Better three hours too soon than a minute too late.
author: William Shakespeare

text: All’s well that ends well.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Hope springs eternal in the human breast.
author: Alexander Pope

text: The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a Heaven of Hell, a Hell of Heaven.
author: John Milton

text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
author: Cicero

text: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.
author: Cicero

text: Fortune favors the bold.
author: Virgil

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche (public-domain translations exist)

text: A soft answer turneth away wrath.
author: Proverbs (KJV)

text: In all labour there is profit.
author: Proverbs (KJV)

text: Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
author: Proverbs (KJV)

text: Be strong and of a good courage.
author: Joshua (KJV)

text: Let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
author: Galatians (KJV)

text: As ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
author: Luke (KJV)

text: Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.
author: Taoist Proverb (public-domain translations exist)

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus (public-domain translations exist)

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labour does the body.
author: Seneca (public-domain translations exist)

text: He conquers who endures.
author: Persius (public-domain translations exist)

text: Make haste slowly.
author: Augustus (Suetonius)

text: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
author: Plato (public-domain translations exist)

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates (via Plato, public-domain translations exist)
